block.p: Sandra Ellen Lavery and William Longest Taylor were married yesterday by the Rev. Terrell L. Glenn Jr., an Anglican minister, at Camp Greystone in Tuxedo, N.C. The Rev. Byron Jay Peters, a Presbyterian minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Taylor, 29, is the program director and staff recruiter for Camp Greystone, a summer camp for girls, where the bridegroom teaches tennis. She graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and received a master's degree in counseling from the university's Charlotte campus. She is a daughter of Ann Lavery of Charlotte and the late Bernard J. Lavery.

Sandra Ellen Lavery and William Longest Taylor were married yesterday by the Rev. Terrell L. Glenn Jr., an Anglican minister, at Camp Greystone in Tuxedo, N.C. The Rev. Byron Jay Peters, a Presbyterian minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Taylor, 29, is the program director and staff recruiter for Camp Greystone, a summer camp for girls, where the bridegroom teaches tennis. She graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and received a master's degree in counseling from the university's Charlotte campus. She is a daughter of Ann Lavery of Charlotte and the late Bernard J. Lavery.

Mr. Taylor, 39, is a partner in Davis Polk & Wardwell, the New York law firm. He graduated from the University of Kentucky and the Yale Law School. He is a son of C. Waitman Taylor Jr. of Owensboro, Ky., and the late Margaret Brannon Taylor.
